p: Conventional medicine and phytotherapy both use olive leaf extracts to treat and prevent arterial hypertension or as diuretics and antiseptics [ 37, 38]. Many studies on olive leaf extract showed that it is able to lower the blood pressure in animals as well as to increase blood flow through the coronary arteries, slow down the heart rate and normalize intestinal muscle contractions [ 37, 39, 40]. In clinical studies including patients with first-degree hypertension treated with olive leaf extract, the tendency to lowering the blood pressure was observed. Twice-daily dosing of 500 mg (1 g/day) of the olive leaf extract was as effective as an alternative medicine that is typically prescribed in order to lower blood pressure [ 41].
